title: How to Make Your Friend Fall in Love with Someone Else

steps.title: Pick out the right person.
steps.content: Pick out the right person. Don't pick out someone who's your type. Pick out someone who he/she would like. Since you like the same person, it may be hard to find the difference in your tastes. But you can find one.

steps.title: Talk about them with your friend.
steps.content: Talk about them with your friend. After you've picked the right person, talk about them. Maybe say something to your friend about something funny they said, or the awesome shirt he/she was wearing. Little things like this.

steps.title: Point out good things about them.
steps.content: Point out good things about them. Start talking about things you notice about them. Is he/she cute? Does he/she listen to good music? Is he/she smart? If you can get your friend to agree, you're on the right track. Keep going.

steps.title: Make excuses for the person's flaws.
steps.content: Make excuses for the person's flaws. If your friend doesn't agree, no problem. If he/she points out flaws, defend them. If they say he/she has a bad haircut, say something about feeling sorry for them because their parents probably made them get it.

steps.title: Point out flaws in other people.
steps.content: Point out flaws in other people. Point out flaws in other people, especially the guy you both like. If you can make this new person seem amazing compared to the first person, they'll probably grow to like the person you chose more.

steps.title: Make the person seem significant.
steps.content: Make the person seem significant. Make it seem like they're always around. Talk about how they “coincidentally” are always there. Make it seem like they might like your friend. Say they're staring at her/him or in your direction.

steps.title: Point them out whenever you see them.
steps.content: Point them out whenever you see them. Nudge your friend's arm or make a cutesy noise. Try to get your friend to look at the person whenever they walks by. If you do this enough, they'll soon start nudging you and pointing the person out. This is a really good thing.

steps.title: Talk about the future they could have.
steps.content: Talk about the future they could have. Now, your friend's probably not planning on marrying the person, but joke about it. Say they could have lots of kids and lots of money. Make them start thinking the person's worth giving a shot.

steps.title: Try to get your friend to talk to them.
steps.content: Try to get your friend to talk to them. Talk to the person yourself if you have to. But find out a little bit more about them. You want your friend to be able to have a good conversation with the person. Try to convince your friend the person's worth talking to.
